artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsunajima Kamekichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 503.8; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 276.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: woman leaning forward, with her brown and yellow striped kimono with black collar slipping off her PL shoulder, lighting a small lamp on a black lacquer shelf, with a pillow roll beneath her; tan basket or box with black handle and red and yellow object (pipe?) between woman and shelf
markings: Artist’s seal: たいそ {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 和田刻 {Wada koku}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Thirty-two Aspects of Behaviors (Fūzoku sanjūnisō 風俗三十二相)
text: No. 27 on the table of contents
title: Appearing Dark, Behavior of a Wife of the Meiji Period
